meanings.definition: The state or quality of being slow or sluggish.
meanings.sent1: Her pokinesses in the race made her finish last.
meanings.sent2: The pokinesses of the old computer frustrated the user.
meanings.sent3: The pokinesses of the sloth was adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: The pokinesses of the traffic resembled a snail's pace.
meanings.sent5: The pokinesses of the turtle was a stark contrast to the hare's speed.

meanings.definition: The act of delaying or procrastinating.
meanings.sent1: His pokinesses in submitting the report caused a delay.
meanings.sent2: Procrastination often leads to pokinesses in completing tasks.
meanings.sent3: Her pokinesses in getting ready made her miss the bus.
meanings.sent4: The pokinesses in decision-making can hinder progress.
meanings.sent5: The pokinesses in starting the project led to a rushed outcome.

meanings.definition: A feeling of boredom or dullness.
meanings.sent1: The pokinesses of the lecture made the students sleepy.
meanings.sent2: Long meetings can sometimes induce pokinesses in participants.
meanings.sent3: His pokinesses during the movie was evident from his yawns.
meanings.sent4: The pokinesses of the rainy day made her want to stay indoors.
meanings.sent5: The pokinesses of the museum tour made him lose interest quickly.
